title: Stranger Things 3 smashes Netflix records and rakes in 64million viewers
text:
64million people tuned into see Stranger Things 3 (Picture: Netflix)

Stranger Things 3 has smashed Netflix records as 64million tuned into watch in the show in the first four weeks alone.

Netflix announced their latest numbers online, with Stranger Things toppling Money Heist who had previously held up the record with 34.3million tuning in to the Spanish crime drama within the space of a week.

Money Heist, aka La Casa de Papel, has still got a lot to celebrate though, and has been crowned the most-watched show in the platform’s non-English-language territories.

The Duffer Brothers’ nostalgic sci-fi epic has helped Netflix beat Wall Street’s third-quarter estimates, bringing the streaming service into a lucrative end of the year.

It’s a pretty good sign then that Stranger Things has been renewed for season four, with the future of the series not yet known beyond that.

With another trip to the Upside Down on its way, and a lot of questions left unanswered, it’s almost a guarantee they could beat the record themselves when the next season drops.

The Duffer Brothers have also signed a big multiyear overall deal with Netflix, which will include Stranger Things as well as some new projects.

Stranger Things is available on Netflix now.
